result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ja'marion C Cooley

records.addlTxt:
9:01 AM Defendant Ja'marion C Cooley appeared by video.  Attorney David Carl Bangert in court for Ja'marion C Cooley.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court reminded Mr Cooley to continue working with Justice Point. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-11-22

Adjustment Number: 22A 095666,
Payable Number: 1037395,
Receipt Number: 22RP040330,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Ja'marion C Cooley appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defendant is not SPD eligible and could not confirm status of Defense Counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a  Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-31-22

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No driving without a valid license.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Ja'marion C Cooley in court with Attorney David Carl Bangert.     Madeline Witte, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge  Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/12/2022@2:30pm
